identificationModule.officialTitle: Long-term Outcome of a Pragmatic Trial of Multifaceted Intervention (STROKE-CARD Care) to Reduce Cardiovascular Risk and Improve Quality-of-life After Ischemic Stroke and Transient Ischemic Attack

descriptionModule.briefSummary: We undertook the STROKE-CARD trial (NCT02156778) between 2014 and 2018 with follow-up until 2019 to evaluate the efficacy of the Post-Stroke disease-management program STROKE-CARD care. To further investigate the long-term efficacy of STROKE-CARD care all participants of the original trial will be invited for a Long-term in Person follow-up (3 - 6 years).

armGroups.label: STROKE CARD Cohort
armGroups.description: Consecutive patients treated at the Department of Neurology of the University Hospital Innsbruck with ischemic stroke or high-risk TIA between 2013 and 2018 and enrolled in the Stroke Card trial, (except for those who aborted the previous trial).

primaryOutcomes.measure: The composite CVD outcome: nonfatal stroke (ischemic or hemorrhagic)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, an average of 4,5 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: The composite CVD outcome: nonfatal myocardial infarction
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, an average of 4,5 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: The composite CVD outcome: vascular death
primaryOutcomes.description: death resulting from an acute myocardial infarction, sudden cardiac death, death due to heart failure, stroke, cardiovascular procedures, and death due to other CV causes.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, an average of 4,5 years

primaryOutcomes.description: quantified with the European Quality of Life 5-Dimensions 3-Levels (EQ-5D-3L) overall health utility score14 with rescaled European visual analogue scale weights.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, an average of 4,5 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: TIA defined as transient neurological deficit \<24h and absence of DWI positive lesions on MRI
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, an average of 4,5 years
through study completion at long term follow up visit, an average of 4,5 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: individual 3-level components of the European Quality of Life 5-Dimensions 3-Levels (EQ-5D-3L) questionnaire14 (i.e. mobility, self-care, usual activities, no pain or discomfort, no anxiety or depression) comparing people reporting no problems (level 1) with those reporting problems (level 2 and 3)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion at long term follow up visit, an average of 4,5 years

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportions of participants achieving target levels of risk factors in each trial arm of the previous STROKE-CARD trial.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Blood pressure \<140/\<90 mmHg or \<130/\<85 mmHg in patients with diabetes mellitus, severe renal impairment; HbA1c \<7.5% at the study visit in patients with diabetes mellitus; having quit smoking by the study visit in patients that had been smokers at baseline in the STROKE-CARD trial; LDL cholesterol \< 100 mg/dL or \<70 mg/dL in high-risk patients (i.e. stroke or TIA due to large-artery atherosclerosis or small-vessel occlusion, other evidence of atherosclerotic vascular disease, baseline diabetes; Metabolic Syndrome (NCEP-ATPIII): reduction of component number by 1, physical activity \>90 minutes; Platelet inhibitor or oral anticoagulation; Oral anticoagulation (INR 2-3, Time in Therapeutic Range (TTR)\>70%) in case of atrial fibrillation (AF), Lipid-lowering medication except for non-atherosclerotic strokes (e.g. vessel dissection).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion at long term follow up visit, an average of 4,5 years

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Inclusion in the previous STROKE-CARD trial (NCT02156778)
* Written informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* none
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: All patients from the STROKE-CARD trial (n=2149) will be contacted by phone or mail for possible enrolment in the study. The STROKE-CARD cohort included consecutive patients with acute ischaemic stroke or TIA (ABCD2-Score ≥ 3) admitted to one of the two study centres (Medical University of Innsbruck, Hospital St. John's of God Vienna) between 2014 and 2018.

overallOfficials.name: Stefan Kiechl, Prof. Dr.
overallOfficials.affiliation: Medical University of Innsbruck, Austria, Department of Neurology

overallOfficials.name: Wilfried Lang, Prof. Dr.
overallOfficials.affiliation: Hospital St. John's of God, Vienna, Austria, Department of Neurology

locations.facility: Medical University of Innsbruck, Department of Neurology

Pragmatic trial of multifaceted intervention (STROKE-CARD care) to reduce cardiovascular risk and improve quality-of-life after ischaemic stroke and transient ischaemic attack -study protocol. Long-term outcome of a pragmatic trial of multifaceted intervention (STROKE-CARD care) to reduce cardiovascular risk and improve quality-of-life after ischaemic stroke and transient ischaemic attack: study protocol. BMC Cardiovasc Disord. 2022 Aug 1;22(1):347. doi: 10.1186/s12872-022-02785-5.
